revised_title: Discovery of the True Rhubarb Plant and Its Properties
tldr: Dr. John Hope, a professor of medicine and botany, received seeds of Rheum palmatum from Dr. Mounsey and successfully grew the plant in his botanic garden. He found that the root had the smell, taste, and purgative qualities of true rhubarb. The plant's similarity to the best foreign rhubarb led to the expectation of it being an important acquisition for Britain.
